All recordings made with Naturblick are licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0, i.e. they may be distributed and used. If you want, you can attribute your authorship with a name. The material will then be published together with this name. All footage that has not been assigned an author name will be published under MfN_Naturblick.
The observation has not been saved. Unsaved observations cannot be recovered.
There are changes that have not been saved.
The suggestions are produced by comparing audio recordings of 239 birds. The closer the score is to 100%, the more likely the match is.
The list suggests wild plants found in the city. The suggestions are created by comparing photos of over 2000 species. The closer the score is to 100%, the more likely the match is.
Naturblick is continuously being further developed in terms of content and technology. We depend on your feedback. Suggest changes, improvements, or report bugs.

Please select a section that best represents the bird\'s sound. Our pattern recognition gives the best results for recordings that are under 10 seconds.

The sources for the image and sound materials are indicated in the respective species portraits. Image and sound materials of species that do not yet have a species portrait or from other contexts of the app, such as identification tools, are given under other sources. German and English names taken in part from GBIF.org (2022), GBIF Home Page. Available from: https://www.gbif.org [28 September 2022].

This disclaimer is to be considered as part of the internet publication from which you were referred. If individual terms or sections of this statement are not legal or correct, the validity and content of the other parts remain uninfluenced by this fact.

In an interdisciplinary team, we are researching and developing digital tools for the urban experience of nature at the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin. For example, we are testing the use of pattern recognition in species identification.

With our smartphone app Naturblick we support the direct experience of nature in the city. With a variety of functions, you can explore nature in the city, identify animals and plants, and save your observations. Also take a look at our plattform. There you will find, for example, a map with confirmed observations of other users and the section "WissensWeiten" with informative and inspiring content for all those who want to take a closer look at the nature around them.

Sound recognition

The results of the automated species identification are generated by comparing them with data (in this case audio recordings of birds) with which the algorithm has been trained.

This means
1) only species that have been trained can be recognized,
2) the recognition works best when there is a high similarity to the recording situation and quality (e.g. microphone quality).

The Naturblick algorithm was trained with audio material from the animal voice archive of the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin, the collaborative online database Xeno-Canto, and verified Naturblick recordings. The list of species that can be identified can be found here.

Image recognition

The results of automated species identification are generated by comparing them to data (in this case photos of plants) with which the algorithm has been trained.

This means
1) only species that have been trained can be recognized,
2) the recognition works best when there is a high similarity to the photo situation and quality (e.g. plants in the wild).

The nature eye algorithm was trained with imagery from naturgucker, the LIFECLEF Challenges, and iNaturalist. The list of species that can be identified can be found here.
Naturblick requires storage permission to write media files

This is the list of devices that were used with Naturblick.
You have been signed out, please sign in again
Credentials not recognized. Please validate your e-mail and password.
I have read and understood privacy statement.
The password must be at least 9 characters long. It must consist of numbers, upper and lower case letters.
We take data protection very seriously. You can find more information about data protection in the app\'s imprint.
A Naturblick account enables you to back up and view your observations across multiple mobile devices.
A Naturblick account enables you to back up and view your observations across multiple mobile devices.
However, you can still use Naturblick without an account.
We have sent you an activation link by email. Please open this link to complete your registration. The link is valid for 12 hours.
No default e-mail app found, please activate your account with the link in the e-mail we sent you.
Your Naturblick account is activated. Log in with your email address and password on all devices you want to connect to the account.

We have sent a password reset link to the email address you provided. The link is valid for 12 hours. If you do not receive an email after 10 minutes, the email address you provided is not associated with an existing account.
Deleting your account will remove the link to other devices and we will automatically delete the email address you provided.
Please, confirm your wish to delete the account by entering your login details.
Advice for the connection with old devices

To transfer observations from old devices to new ones, we recommend that you log in on both devices. If you pass on or recycle your phone, uninstall Naturblick on your phone or simply reset it to its default settings. This will not delete your old observations. Do not delete the account, as this would break the link between the observations.
When you set a new password, all phones linked to the account will be automatically logged out for security reasons. All your observations will remain linked to your account.
Do you really want to delete your account?
Deleting your account will unlink all other devices. You will lose the connection to observations on these devices.
Deleting your account will unlink all other devices. You will lose the connection to %1$d observations.
A Naturblick account enables you to back up and view your observations across multiple mobile devices. Do you want to create an account?
You have been logged out because you have reset your password or deleted your account.
Log in with your new password to link your observations on this phone to your account.
Register a new account or use Naturblick without an account.
You create a Naturblick account here. Please enter an email address. We will send you the activation link to this address.

For the registration we need your email address. The registration is only valid after you have clicked on a confirmation link in an email sent to you by us. The email address will be used by us exclusively for the administration of the account. The registration/login is voluntary and can be revoked at any time. Your personal data will be deleted from our system when the account is deleted.

The processing of the data is carried out in compliance with the applicable data protection regulations. The transmission of your entries is encrypted. In order to protect your data from loss, manipulation or access by unauthorized persons, the Museum für Naturkunde Berlin uses state-of-the-art technical and organizational measures.
Connect all observations on this phone to your account.
A Naturblick account enables you to back up and view your observations across multiple mobile devices.
You can access your Naturblick account only after confirming your registration. To do so, please click on the activation link that we have sent to your email address.
Please confirm that the automatically selected time and date corresponds to when the observation was made. Also select the correct time zone.
You need to specify a time and a date to save an observation
Naturblick needs permission to read media to import images

By using Naturblick, you have agreed to that all media you save will be licensed under CC BY-SA 4.0. This is only possible if you are the author or copyright holder of the work. Please keep this in mind when importing photos from your gallery into the app. We wish you a lot of fun with this new feature!
